alert.note: Alert for Childress; Hall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 12:48AM CDT until July 14 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT FOR CHILDRESS AND NORTHEASTERN HALL COUNTIES... At 1247 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles north of Childress, moving east at 30 mph. The Childress West Texas Mesonet site reported a 66 mph wind gust at 12:40 am. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Childress and Estelline. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
